result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dawyonn M McNeal

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dawyonn M McNeal in court, in custody.  
Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Dawyonn M McNeal.  
Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Final Pretrial. 
Court is in receipt of the State's Motion for adjournment. 
Defense does not object and withdraws the demand for  Speedy trial.
Defense request a plea and sentencing date. 
Defense to file plea documents 48 hours in advance of the hearing.
Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, room 313 of the courthouse. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 03:30 pm.
Received and Filed: State's Motion to Adjourn 11-14-2022 trial date.
Received and filed: STATE'S MOTION IN LIMINE.
Received and filed: STATE'S Requested Jury Instructions.
Received and filed: State's Witness List.
Received and filed: DEFENDANT'S MOTION IN LIMINE.
Received and filed: DEFENDANT'S Proposed Jury Instructions.

Defendant Dawyonn M McNeal not in court, in custody.   
Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Dawyonn M McNeal.  
Attorney William ackell for Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for a Scheduling Conference.
Defense request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.- EXPIRES 11-22-2022

Attorney Conner Helvig in court, defendant Dawyonn M McNeal not in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  Defense filed a request for subsitution of Judge.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Ashley, Br. 19, Rm 313 SB.  Defense is waiting for discovery from the State.  Case adjourned to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.

Attorney Conner Helvig in court, defendant Dawyonn M McNeal not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is waiting on DNA discovery. Case is adjourned.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dawyonn M McNeal in court with Attorney Conner Helvig.  Defendant Dawyonn M McNeal in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
filed.

No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dawyonn M McNeal in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Dawyonn M McNeal in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawyonn M McNeal appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
